subject: IBM Management Console: Replacing crow::Response with bmcweb::AsyncResp
commitMessage:
IBM Management Console: Replacing crow::Response with bmcweb::AsyncResp

The management_console_rest.hpp uses the crow::Response object to
return the response, which is the old way of returning the response to
the client.

This commit brings the bmcweb::AsyncResp class object for sending
the response to the client instead of the crow::Response object

Tested by :
  Performed GET, PATCH, DELETE on the /ibm/v1 resources

Signed-off-by: Sunitha Harish <sunharis@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5ba01bda68d1e6b4590e910bd187aeb9cd6a149b

Hi Reviewers, please add any comments / votes. Thank you

Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

Overall, you only need to pass an AsyncResp object to a method if it's taking ownership of the response.  Most of your function prototypes didn't need to change, which I commented earlier, but you only fixed the one.

With that said, it's functionally the same, just more complex.

Fix the one other thing, and I suspect this can merge if gunnar is ok with it.

Remove this? 
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/36525/1
Done
Can you do this everywhere and remove the "using namespace bmcweb;"
Done

These APIs didn't really need to change, right?  There's no raii handling of the async resp in this context, so it doesn't need to take any ownership.

Just call the old function with asyncresp->res.

With that said, up to you if you want to go back now.  This is arguably no worse, just a little extra unnecessary code.
Done

FYI, if your goal is to make this look like an odata collection API, that's not what it looks like.

With that said, this is in IBM OEM, so do what you want.
Ack
This doesn't need explicitly set.  This is the default.
Done

This is the wrong return code for this kind of thing.  unauthorized means "we can't identify your identity".  The only thing that should be doing that is the bmcweb auth core.

This should likely be 503, service unavailable, with a Retry-After header set.
This is as per the IBM BMC - Management Interface design
This is also a copy.  Not a problem in this patchset, but still an issue.
Ack
Not a change in this patchset, but this is a copy.  You're probably better off just building this in place.
Ack
